newsitem.title: FINLAND: CHIPS SAYS TO RENAME DUTCH POTATOES.
newsitem.headline: CHIPS SAYS TO RENAME DUTCH POTATOES.

text.p: Finnish potato chips maker Ab Chips Oy said on Tuesday it would rename one of its potato products after food authorities ruled that the name was misleading, the company said in a statement on Tuesday.

The authorities ruled that the name "Oolannin uuninrapeat ranskanperuunat" ("Aland oven-crisp chips") gave the misleading impression that the potatoes were from Finland's Aland Islands, when in fact they are made in the Netherlands, Chips said.

"From now on the company will use this brand only on packages of products that are manufacturered in the Aland Islands from domestic potatoes," it said. --Helsinki newsroom +358-9-680 50 235, e-mail news@reuters.fi
